item.title: [BHS][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 1, 05:00 - 07:00 UTC

Jan 24, 07:24 UTC
Update - New start time : 01/02/2024 05:00 UTC
New end time : 01/02/2024 07:00 UTC

Jan 24, 01:43 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 31/01/2024 10:30 UTC
End time : 31/01/2024 12:30 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
The scheduled maintenance consists of an application update.
This update has led to an improvement in certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance improvements.

For the duration of the maintenance, we will switch your HA-NAS service from the primary node to the secondary node, then switch it back to the primary node. Each switchover involves a brief interruption of about a few seconds. Apart from these switches, your data will remain available.

In addition, if you have not forced NFSv3 in your mount options, it is possible that your client will automatically change the NFS version during node failovers and that your mount point will be renegotiated to NFSv4, if it was not already the case.

For more details, please refer to the following documentation if you want to force a version of NFS : https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-storage-nas-nfs?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0046735#nfsv3nfsv4e.

item.title: [BHS][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 31, 08:00 - 10:00 UTC

Jan 24, 01:45 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 31/01/2024 08:00 UTC
End time : 31/01/2024 10:00 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
The scheduled maintenance consists of an application update.
This update has led to an improvement in certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance improvements.

For the duration of the maintenance, we will switch your HA-NAS service from the primary node to the secondary node, then switch it back to the primary node. Each switchover involves a brief interruption of about a few seconds. Apart from these switches, your data will remain available.

In addition, if you have not forced NFSv3 in your mount options, it is possible that your client will automatically change the NFS version during node failovers and that your mount point will be renegotiated to NFSv4, if it was not already the case.

For more details, please refer to the following documentation if you want to force a version of NFS : https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-storage-nas-nfs?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0046735#nfsv3nfsv4e.

item.title: [SBG][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 31, 05:30 - 07:30 UTC

Jan 24, 01:46 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 31/01/2024 05:30 UTC
End time : 31/01/2024 07:30 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
The scheduled maintenance consists of an application update.
This update has led to an improvement in certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance improvements.

For the duration of the maintenance, we will switch your HA-NAS service from the primary node to the secondary node, then switch it back to the primary node. Each switchover involves a brief interruption of about a few seconds. Apart from these switches, your data will remain available.

In addition, if you have not forced NFSv3 in your mount options, it is possible that your client will automatically change the NFS version during node failovers and that your mount point will be renegotiated to NFSv4, if it was not already the case.

For more details, please refer to the following documentation if you want to force a version of NFS : https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-storage-nas-nfs?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0046735#nfsv3nfsv4e.
